definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

pinyin: ai4 qing2 zheng1 fu2 yi1 qie4

sentences.english: Caesar, William the Conquerer allopted for a full invasion of England.
sentences.chinese: 凯撒，威廉这样的征服者都选择完全的侵略英格兰。

sentences.english: As long as we unite and help each other, no one can conquer us.
sentences.chinese: 只要我们团结互助，谁也不能征服我们。

sentences.english: and an aging Challenger-class diesel submarine, the Conqueror.
sentences.chinese: 和老化的挑战者级柴油潜艇“征服者”。

sentences.english: Conquering its challenges has become the quest of Chinese engineers.
sentences.chinese: 征服所有挑战已经成了中国工程师们孜孜的追求。

sentences.english: Tsheri tried to conquer Everest last year but failed.
sentences.chinese: 伽利去年就试过要征服圣母峰，不过没有成功。

sentences.english: The pianist made a conquest of every audience for which she played.
sentences.chinese: 这位钢琴家以她的演奏征服了每一位听众。

sentences.english: He enjoys highlighting the stories of the underdogs—be they the Welsh or the Estonians.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢关注被征服者的故事，如威尔士或爱沙尼亚。

sentences.english: He must exert himself to subdue so proud a display of resentment .
sentences.chinese: 他必须施展本事，征服这种因忌恨而产生的骄傲。

sentences.english: He was particularly associated with protecting stags and subduing snakes.
sentences.chinese: 他与守护神牡鹿和征服蛇怪有密切联系。

sentences.english: Strength alone knows conficts, weakness is below even defeat , and is born vanquished.
sentences.chinese: 弱者甚至连失败都不够资格，而是生来就是被征服的。

sentences.english: However Zhong Ning's ascendancy and fortune do not have conquer poplar luck.
sentences.chinese: 然而钟宁的权势与财富没有征服杨瑞。

sentences.english: With my appearance and intelligence, I can take over the world.
sentences.chinese: 有我的外表和智慧，我可以征服世界。

sentences.english: Shoutin in the street gonna take on the world some day.
sentences.chinese: 叫喊着你将在某一天征服这世界。

sentences.english: Humans may one day colonize other planets.
sentences.chinese: 有一天人类能够征服其他行星。

sentences.english: The Caesar's Legion is comprised mostly of reconditioned tribals and their descendants.
sentences.chinese: 凯撒军团主要由被其征服的部落以及他们的后代组成。

sentences.english: Khan is one of the greatest conquerors who ever lived.
sentences.chinese: 成吉思汗是史上最伟大的征服者之一。

definition: to capture (enemy property or personnel)/capture (physics: absorption of subatomic particle by an atom or nucleus)
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
to topple (i.e. knock over)/to capsize/fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion)/to undermine/to subvert
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
